intro: Melissitus platycarpos, commonly known as the narrow-leaf melissitus, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its fruits are dry, indehiscent schizocarps, and the seeds are small and wind-dispersed. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
